StringTable.Label: BenevolentTier1_Dec
StringTable.String: Benevolent Civilizations believe they can peacefully explore and colonize the galaxy. Outreach gives them the tools they need to do it.

StringTable.Label: BenevolentTier2_Dec
StringTable.String: Through a profound affinity with their people and the races they encounter, Benevolent Civilizations can avoid almost all internal strife.

StringTable.Label: BenevolentTier3_Dec
StringTable.String: Persuasion is one of the primary ways a Benevolent Civilization resolves conflict with others and expands their influence throughout the galaxy.

StringTable.Label: BenevolentTier4_Dec
StringTable.String: The Enlightenment of its citizens is an important goal of a Benevolent Civilization. It helps them keep ahead of the less tolerant races in the galaxy.

StringTable.Label: NeutralTier1_Dec
StringTable.String: Pragmatic Civilizations know that it is better to be safe than sorry and prepare to face the harsh realities of galactic exploration.

StringTable.Label: NeutralTier2_Dec
StringTable.String: Building out a strong infrastructure can be the cornerstone of a Pragmatic Civilizations defensive and economic strategy.

StringTable.Label: NeutralTier3_Dec
StringTable.String: Pragmatic races know an aggressive trade policy with other races can not only be profitable, but can help build strong diplomatic ties.

StringTable.Label: NeutralTier4_Dec
StringTable.String: Negotiation is a powerful weapon in a Pragmatic Civilizations arsenal. With it they can avoid wars and garner support from other races when needed.

StringTable.Label: MercilessTier1_Dec
StringTable.String: Aggression comes naturally to Malevolent Civilizations. Taking is almost always easier than Building, and a lot more fun.

StringTable.Label: MercilessTier2_Dec
StringTable.String: Motivation of its workforce is an art that Malevolent Civilizations master early. High production can be tough, but worth it.

StringTable.Label: MercilessTier3_Dec
StringTable.String: Malevolent Civilizations know that Wealth can be very helpful in getting their way, and they make sure that credits aren't wasted on anything else.

StringTable.Label: MercilessTier4_Dec
StringTable.String: Malevolent Civilizations expect, and demand, respect. Making sure that other races know their strength can reap great rewards in negotiations.
